sub_title: Medical Physicist in Radiology and Nuclear Medicine | Medical Imaging and Molecular Radiotherapy Scientist | Radiation Safety Expert | MBA candidate |
summary: I am a medical physicist with a broad background in medical image analysis and molecular imaging, currently responsible for radiation safety and personalized dosimetry of radionuclide therapy at the Nuclear Medicine and Molecular Imaging department of the University Medical Center Groningen. My ambition is to pursue a career in the field of dosimetric optimization and cost-effective medicine, where medical physics and MBA skills meet. In addition to my work, I am actively involved in various non-profit initiatives, focusing on science communication and academic support of displaced researchers.

awards.title: SPIE Medical Imaging  2021 - Young Scientist Award
awards.description:
I was selected as a recipient of the Young Scientist Awards within SPIE Medical Imaging 2021. The award is granted to a young scientist, who is a first author of highly ranked work presented within the Image-Guided Procedures conference. This was a collaboration between the Netherlands Cancer Institute and the Leiden University Medical Center, and it would not be possible to achieve this high honor without help of dr. Zhiwei Zhai, dr. Berend Stoel and prof. Theo Ruers.
Check our work on the website of SPIE Medical Imaging: 
Optimization of hepatic vasculature segmentation from contrast-enhanced MRI, exploring two 3D Unet modifications and various loss functions (Paper 11598-16)

2016 Alavi–Mandell Publication Award
awards.description:
Each year the SNMMI selects recipients of Alavi–Mandell publication awards. The award is given to individuals who were in training or students at the time the work was carried out and made a major contribution to the completion of the project. Also, the individual is the first author of the paper published in the Journal of Nuclear Medicine. 
This year I was selected as a recipient of the Alavi-Mandell Award for my publication entitled,  “Ultra-High-Sensitivity Submillimeter Mouse SPECT”  (doi: 10.2967/jnumed.114.147140).

profile_positions.description: Special focus: radiation safety, personalized dosimetry for molecular radiotherapy, image quality and quantification accuracy of PET/CT, PET/MRI and SPECT/CT imaging.
profile_positions.title: Medical Physicist - Nuclear Medicine and Molecular Imaging

profile_positions.description: The Radiology: AI Trainee Editorial Board (TEB) is a highly-competitive 2-year opportunity in which TEB members learn about peer review, research design and journalistic ethics. TEB members participate in the journal's review process and contribute to the journal's activities.
profile_positions.title: The Radiology: AI Trainee Editorial Board member

profile_positions.description:
National medical physicists training program in Radiology and Nuclear Medicine.

Main focus: image quality and radiation dose optimization of X-ray based modalities, image analyses and automatic segmentation using deep learning, quantitative imaging with PET/CT and PET/MRI, validation of AI in healthcare.
profile_positions.title: Medical Physics Resident in Radiology and Nuclear Medicine

profile_positions.description: Development of methods for automatic segmentation of liver anatomy and malignancies from MRI and intra-operative ultrasound. Tomographic reconstruction of freehand ultrasound images.
profile_positions.title: Imaging Scientist | Surgical Oncology

profile_positions.description: Automatic segmentation of liver vasculature from diagnostic MRI using deep-learning. Collaborative project between the NKI-AvL, as well as Medical Physics and LKEB Groups of the LUMC. Conference paper summarizing results of the project has won the Young Scientist Award of SPIE Medical Imaging 2021.
profile_positions.title: Medical Physics Residency Research Project | Image Processing within Surgical Oncology

profile_positions.description: Evaluation of quantification accuracy and investigation possible attenuation correction methods for head and neck applications of PET/MRI within radiotherapy.
profile_positions.title: Internship - Head and neck applications of PET/MRI within radiotherapy

profile_positions.description:
Working at the clinical implementation team for image-guided surgery, focused on development and implementation of new image-guidance techniques for cancer surgery.
Main areas of research: automatic segmentation, virtual planning of surgical resections, electromagnetic surgical navigation.
profile_positions.title: Postdoc, Clinical Implementation Team for  Image-guided Surgery

volunteer_experiences.description: Het doel van het project is te komen tot een kennisagenda met een beschrijving van de belangrijkste kennishiaten en een plan van aanpak hoe deze d.m.v. wetenschappelijk onderzoek in te vullen. Invulling van deze kennishiaten geeft gezondheidswinst voor de patiënt en meer doelmatige zorg.

company.name: European Federation Of Organizations For Medical Physics - EFOMP

volunteer_experiences.role: Memeber of the NCS subcommittee on automated segmentation and deformable image registration
volunteer_experiences.description:
This NCS subcommittee aims to give an overview of literature, possibilities and pitfalls of different deformable image registration (DIR) techniques, as well as provide guidance for their commissioning within RT applications. The subcommittee officially started May 2019.
https://radiationdosimetry.org/ncs/clinical-application-of-deformable-image-registration-and-auto-segmentation-in-radiotherapy

The MCAA Communication Working Group aims to meet the real needs/expectations of members and also increase the visibility of the association to the rest of the research community and the general public.

volunteer_experiences.role: Outreach to Ukrainian organizations and scholarly communities
volunteer_experiences.description: #ScienceForUkraine is a community group of volunteer students and research scientists from academic institutions in Europe and around the world. Our mission is to collect and disseminate information about support opportunities at the university, national, and international level for graduate students and researchers directly affiliated to an academic institution in Ukraine.

company.name: European Federation Of Organizations For Medical Physics - EFOMP

volunteer_experiences.description: The CP Committee is responsible to the Council of the Federation for the representation and promotion of the EFOMP activities to the public. More info can be found here: https://www.efomp.org/index.php?r=structure/view&id=5

volunteer_experiences.role: Co-organizer of the AAPM Grand Challenge on Time-activity curve fitting

company.name: American Association of Physicists in Medicine

volunteer_experiences.description:
The TACTIC challenge zooms in on one of the most important sub-aspects of radiopharmaceutical therapy (RPT)  dosimetry: time-activity curve (TAC) determination. Participants will be presented with a series of snapshots of precisely known time-activity curves at clinically relevant sampling time points. Based on their submitted TAC functions and TIA values, the Challenge Team will assess the degree of variation between different means of TAC/TIA estimation. Among all submissions, we will identify the best-performing methods including their uncertainties and thus take a decisive step towards improved robustness of TAC/TIA determination for RPTs.

More information: https://www.aapm.org/GrandChallenge/TACTIC/default.asp

volunteer_experiences.role: Committee on Medical Internal Radiation Dose (MIRD) Member

company.name: Society of Nuclear Medicine and Molecular Imaging (SNMMI)

volunteer_experiences.description: The MIRD Committee develops standard methods, models, assumptions, and mathematical schema for assessing internal radiation doses from administered radiopharmaceuticals. In 2023, I have been selected as the newest member to join the committee.
